metadata.Title: CVE-2021-42374 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
An out-of-bounds heap read in Busybox's unlzma applet leads to information leak and denial of service when crafted LZMA-compressed input is decompressed. This can be triggered by any applet/format that

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-42374` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

busybox - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu3.4
busybox-initramfs - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu3.4
busybox-static - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu3.4
busybox-syslogd - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu3.4
udhcpc - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu3.4
udhcpd - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu3.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: busybox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.27.2-2ubuntu3.4').
